required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exclusive Breastfeeding in Infants of Mothers Infected With Novel Coronavirus
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Exclusive Breastfeeding Within the First Six Months in Infants of Mothers Infected With Novel Coronavirus: 1-year Experience of a Single Center

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: COVID-19 pandemic emerges an issue for breastfeeding.Earlier in pandemic mothers who had COVID-19 were separated from their babies due to insufficient data but this approach was abandoned due to the lack of transmission via breastmilk.However, where mothers with COVID-19 are cohorted in the same room, they still have to be isolated from their babies following the birth.Investigators aimed to evaluate rate of exclusive breastfeeding(EB) within first 6 months among mothers who were isolated from their babies due to COVID-19.

detailed_description.textblock: COVID-19 pandemic emerges an issue for breastfeeding.Earlier in pandemic mothers who had COVID-19 were separated from their babies due to insufficient data but this approach was abandoned due to the lack of transmission via breastmilk.However, where mothers with COVID-19 are cohorted in the same room, they still have to be isolated from their babies following the birth.To our knowledge, there is no study regarding this subject to-date.Therefore, investigators aimed to evaluate rate of exclusive breastfeeding(EB) within first 6 months among mothers who were isolated from their babies due to COVID-19.

arm_group.description: Infants of mothers with suspected but negative for COVID-19
Infants Born to COVID-19 positive mothers

intervention.description: Nasopharyngeal swab for detecting Novel Coronavirus-2 by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction

study_pop.textblock: Infants who were born to mothers with suspected/proven COVID-19

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants who were born to mothers with suspected or evident COVID-19
- Accepted to participate with an informed consent of parents
Exclusion Criteria:
- Congenital abnormalities
- Chromosomal abnormalities
- Contraindication for breastfeeding
- Declined to participate

facility.name: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: The datasets generated during and/or analyzed during the current study are available from the corresponding author on reasonable request.
